snippet: The move also sought to cut a major jihadist supply line between Syria and the Iraqi city of Mosul.
abstract: Roughly 7,500 Kurdish fighters undertake three-pronged offensive to reclaim western Iraqi town of Sinjar from Islamic State forces; target zone is bombed by United States coalition air forces in preparation for battle; town was taken by over one year earlier by Islamic State fighters who murdered, raped and enslaved native Yazidis.
lead_paragraph: The move also sought to cut a major jihadist supply line between Syria and the Iraqi city of Mosul.

headline.main: Kurds, Backed by U.S. Air Power, Try to Regain Sinjar From ISIS
headline.print_headline: Kurds, Backed by U.S. Air Power, Open an Offensive Against ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
